ProjectTitle: Label-free imaging of cellular activity using second harmonic generation
InitialFeedbackHistory:
15/07/2022
4. Documentation, Metadata: please describe here how you document your data, are you using protocols, sops, readme files, (e) notebooks? In the data table you mention spectra with metadata, does this metadata follow a standard, please also explain this here. 
6. Preservation: For data preservation onedrive is not the best solution since this is linked to your account and expires after you leave please have a look at the storage guide for alternative solutions: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/nl
7. Sharing: have you considered using a repository for preservation and sharing? If there is a disciplinary repository in your field that is likely the best place to deposit your data, if there is none you can use KU Leuven RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr), this makes it easier for others to find your data and the repository will give you a DOI that you can mention in your publications. 

08/07/2022
Please answer all questions in the DMP template and resubmit your updated DMP. You can find more information on the new RDM website: www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance and in the guidance in DMP online (https://dmponline.kuleuven.be/). If you like to discuss your DMP with an RDM expert in your field please contact onderzoek2bergen@kuleuven.be
label: good with suggestions
